intro: Diplocyclos palmatus subsp. affinis, commonly known as the African sandbush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought resistance. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Rubiaceae family.
